alert.note: Alert for San Diego (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 12 at 5:29PM PDT until August 12 at 8:30PM PDT by NWS SanDiego
info.description: The National Weather Service in San Diego has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central San Diego County in southwestern California... * Until 830 PM PDT. * At 529 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Hwy 78 Between S2 And Borrego Springs Rd, Mount Laguna, Hwy 78 Between Banner And S2, Hwy 78 Between Borrego Springs Rd And Ocotillo Wells, Borrego Springs, Hwy S2 Between Shelter Valley And Agua Caliente, Hwy S2 Between Agua Caliente And Canebrake, Fish Creek Wash, Hwy S1 Between Lake Cuyamaca And Mount Laguna, Hwy S2 Vallecito Creek Rd, Hwy S2 Between Canebrake And Imperial County Line, Agua Caliente, Shelter Valley and Canebrake. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
